registers.name: AIN#(0:254)
registers.description: Returns the voltage of the specified analog input.

registers.name: DAC#(0:1)
registers.description: Pass a voltage for the specified analog output.

registers.name: FIO#(0:7)
registers.description: Read or set the state of 1 bit of digital I/O.  Also configures the direction to input or output.

registers.name: EIO#(0:7)
registers.description: Read or set the state of 1 bit of digital I/O.  Also configures the direction to input or output.

registers.name: CIO#(0:3)
registers.description: Read or set the state of 1 bit of digital I/O.  Also configures the direction to input or output.

registers.name: MIO#(0:2)
registers.description: Read or set the state of 1 bit of digital I/O.  Also configures the direction to input or output.

registers.name: FIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 8 bits of FIO in a single binary-encoded value.  Does not configure direction.  A read of an output returns the current logic level on the terminal, not necessarily the output state written.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: EIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 8 bits of EIO in a single binary-encoded value.  Does not configure direction.  A read of an output returns the current logic level on the terminal, not necessarily the output state written.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: CIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 4 bits of CIO in a single binary-encoded value.  Does not configure direction.  A read of an output returns the current logic level on the terminal, not necessarily the output state written.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: MIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of the 3 bits of MIO in a single binary-encoded value.  Does not configure direction.  A read of an output returns the current logic level on the terminal, not necessarily the output state written.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: FIO_DIRECTION
registers.description: Read or write the direction of the 8 bits of FIO in a single binary-encoded value.  0=Input and 1=Output.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: EIO_DIRECTION
registers.description: Read or write the direction of the 8 bits of EIO in a single binary-encoded value.  0=Input and 1=Output.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: CIO_DIRECTION
registers.description: Read or write the direction of the 4 bits of CIO in a single binary-encoded value.  0=Input and 1=Output.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: MIO_DIRECTION
registers.description: Read or write the direction of the 3 bits of MIO in a single binary-encoded value.  0=Input and 1=Output.  The upper 8-bits of this value are inhibits.

registers.name: DIO_STATE
registers.description: Read or write the state of all digital I/O in a single binary-encoded value.  Does not configure direction.  A read of an output returns the current logic level on the terminal, not necessarily the output state written.  Writes only apply to bits with mask set.

registers.name: DIO_DIRECTION
registers.description: Read or write the direction of all digital I/O in a single binary-encoded value.  0=Input and 1=Output.  Writes only apply to bits with mask set.

registers.name: DIO_INHIBIT
registers.description: A single binary-encoded value where each bit determines whether _STATE or _DIRECTION writes affect that bit of digital I/O.  0=Default=Affected, 1=Ignored.

registers.name: STREAM_SCANRATE_HZ
registers.description: The number of times per second that all channels in the scanlist will be read.

registers.name: STREAM_NUM_ADDRESSES
registers.description: The number of entries in the scanlist

registers.name: STREAM_SAMPLES_PER_PACKET
registers.description: Specifies the number of data points to be sent in the data packet.

registers.name: STREAM_SETTLING_US
registers.description: Time in microseconds to allow signals to settle after switching the mux. Default 10 us.

registers.name: STREAM_RESOLUTION_INDEX
registers.description: Index specifying the resolution of the data. High settings will have lower max speeds.

registers.name: STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE_BYTES

devices.description: Max size is 32768. Default size is 4096.

registers.description: Size of the stream data buffer in bytes. Must be a power of 2. 0 is updated to the default size upon stream starting. Changes while stream is running do not affect the currently running stream.

registers.name: STREAM_AUTO_TARGET
registers.description: Controls where data will be sent.

registers.name: STREAM_NUM_SCANS
registers.description: The number of scans to run before automatically stopping.

registers.name: STREAM_EXTERNAL_CLOCK_DIVISOR
registers.description: The number of pulses per scan when using an external clock.

registers.name: STREAM_SCANLIST_ADDRESS#(0:127)
registers.description: A list of addresses to read each scan.

registers.name: STREAM_ENABLE
registers.description: Write 1 to start stream. Write 0 to stop stream.

registers.name: SPI_CS_DIONUM
registers.description: The DIO line for Chip-Select.

registers.name: SPI_CLK_DIONUM
registers.description: The DIO line for Clock.

registers.name: SPI_MISO_DIONUM
registers.description: The DIO line for Master-In-Slave-Out.

registers.name: SPI_MOSI_DIONUM
registers.description: The DIO line for Master-Out-Slave-In.

registers.name: SPI_MODE
registers.description: The SPI mode controls the clock idle state and which edge clocks the data. Bit 1 is CPOL and Bit 0 is CPHA, so CPOL/CPHA for different decimal values: 0 = 0/0 = b00, 1 = 0/1 = b01, 2 = 1/0 = b10, 3 = 1/1 = b11.

registers.name: SPI_SPEED_THROTTLE
registers.description: This value controls the SPI clock frequency.  Pass 0-65535.  Default=0 corresponds to 65536 internally which results in ~1 MHz.  1 results in ~100 Hz.

registers.name: SPI_OPTIONS
registers.description: Bit 0 is Auto-CS-Disable.

registers.name: SPI_NUM_BYTES
registers.description: The number of bytes to transfer.

registers.name: SPI_DATA_WRITE
registers.description: Write data here.  Doing so causes the communication to happen.

registers.name: SPI_DATA_READ
registers.description: Read data here.

registers.name: I2C_SDA_DIONUM
registers.description: The number of the DIO line that is to used as the I2C data line. Ex: Writing 0 will force FIO0 to become the I2C-SDA line.

registers.name: I2C_SCL_DIONUM
registers.description: The number of the DIO line that is to used as the I2C clock line. Ex: Writing 1 will force FIO1 to become the I2C-SCL line.

registers.name: I2C_SPEED_THROTTLE
registers.description: This value controls the I2C clock frequency.  Pass 0-65535.  Default=0 corresponds to 65536 internally which results in ~450 kHz.  1 results in ~40 Hz.

registers.name: I2C_OPTIONS
registers.description: Advanced. Controls details of the I2C protocol to improve device compatibility.

registers.name: I2C_SLAVE_ADDRESS
registers.description: The 7-bit address of the slave device. Value is shifted over automatically to allow room for the I2C R/W bit.

registers.name: I2C_NUM_BYTES_TX
registers.description: The number of data bytes to transmit.

registers.name: I2C_NUM_BYTES_RX
registers.description: The number of data bytes to read.

registers.name: I2C_GO
registers.description: Writing to this register will instruct the LabJack to perform an I2C transaction.

registers.name: I2C_ACKS
registers.description: An array of bits used to observe ACKs from the slave device.

registers.name: I2C_WRITE_DATA
registers.description: Data that will be written to the I2C bus.

registers.name: I2C_READ_DATA
registers.description: Data that has been read from the I2C bus.

registers.name: TDAC#(0:22)
registers.description: Update a voltage output on an LJTick-DAC.  Even # = DACA, Odd # = DACB.

registers.name: TDAC_SERIAL_NUMBER
registers.description: Returns the serial number of an LJTick-DAC, and forces a re-read of the calibration constants. Which LJTDAC is determined by the last write to TDAC# ... whether it was successful or not.

registers.name: SBUS#(0:22)_TEMP
registers.description: Reads temperature in degrees Kelvin from an SBUS sensor (EI-1050/SHT1x/SHT7x).  # is the DIO line for the EI-1050 enable.  If # is the same as the value specified for data or clock line, there will be no control of an enable line.

registers.name: SBUS#(0:22)_RH
registers.description: Reads humidity in % from an SBUS sensor (EI-1050/SHT1x/SHT7x).  # is the DIO line for the EI-1050 enable.  If # is the same as the value specified for data or clock line, there will be no control of an enable line.

registers.name: SBUS#(0:22)_DATA_DIONUM
registers.description: This is the DIO# that the sensor's data line is connected to. Default = FIO0

registers.name: SBUS#(0:22)_CLOCK_DIONUM
registers.description: This is the DIO# that the sensor's clock line is connected to. Default = FIO1

registers.name: SBUS#(0:22)_BACKGROUND_ENABLE
registers.description: Currently unsupported.

registers.name: SBUS_ALL_DATA_DIONUM
registers.description: A write to this global parameter sets all SBUS data line registers to the same value. A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return 0xFF.

registers.name: SBUS_ALL_CLOCK_DIONUM
registers.description: A write to this global parameter sets all SBUS clock line registers to the same value. A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return 0xFF.

registers.name: SBUS_ALL_POWER_DIONUM
registers.description: Sets the power line. This DIO is set to output-high upon any read of SBUS#_TEMP or SBUS#_RH. Default = FIO2. An FIO line can power up to 4 sensors while an EIO/CIO/MIO line or DAC line can power up to 20 sensors. Set to 9999 to disable. To use multiple power lines, use a DAC line for power, or otherwise control power yourself, set this to 9999 and then control power using writes to normal registers such as FIO5, EIO0, or DAC0.

registers.name: AIN#(0:254)_RANGE
registers.description: The range/span of each analog input. If all channels are the same, this reads the correct value, but otherwise this reads -9999.0.

registers.name: AIN#(0:254)_NEGATIVE_CH

devices.description: For base differential channels, positive must be even channel from 0-12 and negative must be positive+1.  For extended channels 16-127, see Mux80 datasheet.

registers.description: Specifies the negative channel to be used for each positive channel. 199=Default=> Single-Ended. If all channels are the same, this reads the correct value, but otherwise this reads 0xFFFF.

registers.name: AIN#(0:254)_RESOLUTION_INDEX

devices.description: Valid values:  1-8 for T7, 1-12 for T7-Pro.  0=Default=> 8 (T7) or 9 (T7-Pro).

registers.description: The resolution index for each analog input. A larger resolution index generally results in lower noise and longer sample times. If all channels are the same, this reads the correct value, but otherwise this reads 0xFFFF.

registers.name: AIN#(0:254)_SETTLING_US
registers.description: Settling time for command-response readings. If all channels are the same, this reads the correct value, but otherwise this reads -9999.0.

registers.name: AIN_ALL_RANGE
registers.description: A write to this global parameter affects all AIN.  A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return -9999.

registers.name: AIN_ALL_NEGATIVE_CH
registers.description: A write to this global parameter affects all AIN.  A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return 0xFFFF.

registers.name: AIN_ALL_RESOLUTION_INDEX
registers.description: A write to this global parameter affects all AIN.  A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return 0xFFFF.

registers.name: AIN_ALL_SETTLING_US
registers.description: A write to this global parameter affects all AIN.  A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return -9999.

registers.name: AIN_ALL_EF_TYPE
registers.description: A write to this global parameter affects all AIN.  A read will return the correct setting if all channels are set the same, but otherwise will return 0xFFFFFFFF.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK0_COUNT
registers.description: Current tick count of this clock.  Will read between 0 and ROLL_VALUE-1.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK1_COUNT
registers.description: Current tick count of this clock.  Will read between 0 and ROLL_VALUE-1.

registers.name: DIO_EF_CLOCK2_COUNT
registers.description: Current tick count of this clock.  Will read between 0 and ROLL_VALUE-1.

registers.name: DIO#(0:22)_EF_INDEX
registers.description: An index to specify the feature you want.

registers.name: POWER_ETHERNET
registers.description: The current ON/OFF state of the Ethernet module. Provided to optionally reduce power consumption.

registers.name: POWER_WIFI
registers.description: The current ON/OFF state of the WiFi module. Provided to optionally reduce power consumption.

registers.name: POWER_AIN
registers.description: The current ON/OFF state of the analog input module. Provided to optionally reduce power consumption.

registers.name: POWER_LED
registers.description: The current ON/OFF state of the LEDs. Provided to optionally reduce power consumption.

registers.name: POWER_ETHERNET_DEFAULT
registers.description: The ON/OFF state of the Ethernet module after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: POWER_WIFI_DEFAULT
registers.description: The ON/OFF state of the WiFi module after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: POWER_AIN_DEFAULT
registers.description: The ON/OFF state of the analog input module after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: POWER_LED_DEFAULT
registers.description: The ON/OFF state of the LEDs after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: TEMPERATURE_AIR_K
registers.description: Returns the estimated ambient air temperature just outside a T7 in its red plastic enclosure.  This register is equal to TEMPERATURE_DEVICE_K - 4.3.  If Ethernet and/or WiFi is enabled, subtract an extra 0.6 for each.

registers.name: TEMPERATURE_DEVICE_K
registers.description: Takes a reading from AIN14 using range=+/-10V and resolution=8, and applies the formula Volts*-92.6+467.6 to return degrees K.  AIN14 is internally connected to an LM94021 (U24) with GS=10 which is physically located on the bottom of the PCB between the AIN0/1 and AIN2/3 screw-terminals.

registers.name: ETHERNET_IP
registers.description: Read the current IP address of wired Ethernet.

registers.name: ETHERNET_SUBNET
registers.description: Read the current subnet of wired Ethernet.

registers.name: ETHERNET_GATEWAY
registers.description: Read the current gateway of wired Ethernet.

registers.name: ETHERNET_DNS
registers.description: Read the current DNS of wired Ethernet.

registers.name: ETHERNET_ALTDNS
registers.description: Read the current Alt DNS of wired Ethernet.

registers.name: ETHERNET_DHCP_ENABLE
registers.description: Read the current Enabled/Disabled state of Ethernet DHCP.

registers.name: ETHERNET_IP_DEFAULT
registers.description: The IP address of wired Ethernet after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_SUBNET_DEFAULT
registers.description: The subnet of wired Ethernet after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_GATEWAY_DEFAULT
registers.description: The gateway of wired Ethernet after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_DNS_DEFAULT
registers.description: The DNS of wired Ethernet after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_ALTDNS_DEFAULT
registers.description: The Alt DNS of wired Ethernet after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: ETHERNET_DHCP_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: The Enabled/Disabled state of Ethernet DHCP after a power-cycle to the device.

registers.name: WIFI_IP
registers.description: Read the current IP address of WiFi.

registers.name: WIFI_SUBNET
registers.description: Read the current subnet of WiFi.

registers.name: WIFI_GATEWAY
registers.description: Read the current gateway of WiFi.

registers.name: WIFI_DHCP_ENABLE
registers.description: Read the current Enabled/Disabled state of WiFi DHCP.

registers.name: WIFI_SSID
registers.description: Read the current SSID (network name) of WiFi

registers.name: WIFI_IP_DEFAULT
registers.description: The new IP address of WiFi. Use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS.

registers.name: WIFI_SUBNET_DEFAULT
registers.description: The new subnet of WiFi.  Use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS.

registers.name: WIFI_GATEWAY_DEFAULT
registers.description: The new gateway of WiFi. Use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS.

registers.name: WIFI_DHCP_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: The new Enabled/Disabled state of WiFi DHCP. Use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS

registers.name: WIFI_SSID_DEFAULT
registers.description: The new SSID (network name) of WiFi. Use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS.

registers.name: WIFI_PASSWORD_DEFAULT
registers.description: Write the password for the WiFi network, then use WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS.

registers.name: WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS
registers.description: Apply all new WiFi settings: IP, Subnet, Gateway, DHCP, SSID, Password. 1=Apply

registers.name: WIFI_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_TO_VERSIONX
registers.description: Start an update by using USB or Ethernet to write the desired version to update to.

registers.name: WIFI_STATUS
registers.description: Status Codes.

registers.name: WIFI_RSSI
registers.description: WiFi RSSI (signal strength).  Typical values are -40 for very good, and -75 for very weak.  The T7 microcontroller only gets a new RSSI value from the WiFi module when WiFi communication occurs.

registers.name: WIFI_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_STATUS
registers.description: See status codes in the constants array.

registers.name: AIN#(0:254)_BINARY
registers.description: Returns the binary representation of the specified analog input.

registers.name: TEST
registers.description: A read of this test register should always return 0x00112233 or d1122867. If your software has the word swap quirk, you will incorrectly read 0x22330011 or 573767697.  If your software has the address-1 quirk, a UINT16 (1-register) read from 55101 will incorrectly return 0x0011 (should read 0x2233).

registers.name: TEST_UINT16
registers.description: Write a value and read back to test UINT16 operation. Default is 0x0011 or d17.

registers.name: TEST_UINT32
registers.description: Write a value and read back to test UINT32 operation. Default is 0x00112233 or d1122867. If your software has the word swap quirk, the default will incorrectly read 0x22330011 or 573767697.

registers.name: TEST_INT32
registers.description: Write a value and read back to test INT32 operation. Default is 0x8899AABB or d-2003195205. If your software has the word swap quirk, the default will incorrectly read 0xAABB8899 or -1430550375.

registers.name: TEST_FLOAT32
registers.description: Write a value and read back to test FLOAT32 operation. Default is 0xC61C3C00 or -9999.0. If your software has the word swap quirk, the default will incorrectly read 0x3C00C61C or 0.00786.

registers.name: PRODUCT_ID
registers.description: The numeric identifier of the device.  Such as 3 for a U3-HV.

registers.name: HARDWARE_VERSION
registers.description: The hardware version of the device.

registers.name: FIRMWARE_VERSION
registers.description: The current firmware version installed on the main processor.

registers.name: BOOTLOADER_VERSION
registers.description: The bootloader version installed on the main processor.

registers.name: WIFI_VERSION
registers.description: The current firmware version of the WiFi module, if available.

registers.name: HARDWARE_INSTALLED
registers.description: Bitmask indicating installed hardware options. 0 = High-Res ADC, 1 = WiFi.

registers.name: ETHERNET_MAC
registers.description: The MAC address of the wired Ethernet module.

registers.name: WIFI_MAC
registers.description: The MAC address of the WiFi module.

registers.name: SERIAL_NUMBER
registers.description: The serial number of the device.

registers.name: DEVICE_NAME_DEFAULT
registers.description: The current device name. Up to 49 characters, cannot contain periods.

registers.name: CORE_TIMER
registers.description: Internal 32-bit system timer running at 1/2 core speed, thus normally 80M/2 => 40 MHz.

registers.name: SYSTEM_REBOOT
registers.description: Issues a device reboot. Must write 0x4C4Axxxx, where xxxx is number of 50ms ticks to wait before reboot.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Write a 1 to enable the watchdog or a 0 to disable.  The watchdog must be disabled before writing any of the other watchdog registers (except for WATCHDOG_STRICT_CLEAR).

registers.name: WATCHDOG_ADVANCED_DEFAULT
registers.description: A single binary-encoded value where each bit is an advanced option. If bit 0 is set, IO_CONFIG_SET_CURRENT_TO_FACTORY will be done on timeout.  If bit 1 is set, IO_CONFIG_SET_CURRENT_TO_DEFAULT will be done on timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT_S_DEFAULT
registers.description: When the device receives any communication over USB/Ethernet/WiFi, the watchdog timer is cleared.  If the watchdog timer is not cleared within the timeout period, the enabled actions will be done.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_STARTUP_DELAY_S_DEFAULT
registers.description: This specifies the initial timeout period at device bootup.  This is used until the first time the watchdog is cleared or timeout ... after that the normal timeout is used.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_STRICT_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Set to 1 to enable strict mode.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_STRICT_KEY_DEFAULT
registers.description: When set to strict mode, this is the value that must be written to the clear register.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_STRICT_CLEAR
registers.description: When running in strict mode, writing the key to this register is the only way to clear the watchdog.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_RESET_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Timeout action:  Set to 1 to enable device-reset on watchdog timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DIO_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Timeout action:  Set to 1 to enable DIO update on watchdog timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DIO_STATE_DEFAULT
registers.description: The state high/low of the digital I/O after a Watchdog timeout. See DIO_STATE

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DIO_DIRECTION_DEFAULT
registers.description: The direction input/output of the digital I/O after a Watchdog timeout. See DIO_DIRECTION

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DIO_INHIBIT_DEFAULT
registers.description: The inhibit mask of the digital I/O after a Watchdog timeout. See DIO_INHIBIT

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DAC0_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Timeout action:  Set to 1 to enable DAC0 update on watchdog timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DAC0_DEFAULT
registers.description: The voltage of DAC0 after a Watchdog timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DAC1_ENABLE_DEFAULT
registers.description: Timeout action:  Set to 1 to enable DAC1 update on watchdog timeout.

registers.name: WATCHDOG_DAC1_DEFAULT
registers.description: The voltage of DAC1 after a Watchdog timeout.

registers.name: EXTERNAL_FLASH_KEY
registers.description: Sets the region of external flash to which access is allowed.

registers.name: EXTERNAL_FLASH_READ_POINTER
registers.description: The address in external flash that reads will start from.

registers.name: EXTERNAL_FLASH_READ
registers.description: Data read from external flash.

registers.name: EXTERNAL_FLASH_ERASE
registers.description: Erases a 4k section of flash starting at the specified address.

registers.name: EXTERNAL_FLASH_WRITE_POINTER
registers.description: Address in flash where writes will begin.

registers.name: EXTERNAL_FLASH_WRITE
registers.description: Data written here will be written to external flash.

registers.name: DGT_TEMPERATURE_LATEST_RAW
registers.description: Get the latest temperature conversion, and begin a new conversion. Units are described in TMP112 datasheet.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_RAW
registers.description: Craw. Get a new humidity reading from HCH-1000. Units are in 100s fF of capacitance.

registers.name: DGT_LIGHT_RAW
registers.description: Counts. Get a new light reading from LED. Units are in counts before reverse leakage complete.

registers.name: DGT_LOG_TEMPERATURE
registers.description: Store temperature readings to memory at the log interval. 1=Enabled, 0=Disabled

registers.name: DGT_LOG_LIGHT
registers.description: Store light readings to memory at the log interval. Requires temperature also logged. 1=Enabled, 0=Disabled

registers.name: DGT_LOG_HUMIDITY
registers.description: Store humidity readings to memory at the log interval. Requires temperature also logged. 1=Enabled, 0=Disabled

registers.name: DGT_INDEX_LOG_INTERVAL
registers.description: The index of the time interval between log events. 0=10s, 1=30s, 2=1m, 3=10m, 4=30m, 5=1h, 6=6h

registers.name: DGT_LOG_START_TIME
registers.description: The start time of the logging session: 22042 Year=0 to 99, 22043 Month=1 to 12, 22044 Day=1 to 31, 22045 Weekday=1 to 7, 22046 Hour=0 to 23, 22047 Minutes=0 to 59, 22048 Second=0 to 59

registers.name: DGT_nALARM_FLAGS
registers.description: A bitmask of all alarm and error flags. 0=Occured, 1=Did NOT occur. Refer to documentation for more information

registers.name: DGT_nTRIG_HIGH_ALARM
registers.description: User high threshold alarm triggered. 0=Occured, 1=Did NOT occur

registers.name: DGT_nTRIG_LOW_ALARM
registers.description: User low threshold alarm triggered. 0=Occured, 1=Did NOT occur

registers.name: DGT_nALARM_ARMED
registers.description: User alarms armed flag. 0=Armed, 1=Not yet armed

registers.name: DGT_nLOW_BATT
registers.description: Low battery system warning flag. 0=Occured, 1=Did NOT occur. Low battery (<2.73V) can happen at very low temperatures, even if the battery is new, which is why this is only a warning.

registers.name: DGT_INDEX_ALARM_ITEM
registers.description: Index of the user alarm item. 0=None, 1=Temperature, 2=Light, 3=Humidity. Valid results require that the corresponding item is being logged.

registers.name: DGT_INDEX_ALARM_ARM_CONDITION
registers.description: Index of the alarm arming condition. 0=Arm once within threshold window, 1=Arm after pure time delay

registers.name: DGT_HIGH_ALARM_ENABLE
registers.description: User high threshold alarm enable. 0=Disabled, 1=Enabled

registers.name: DGT_LOW_ALARM_ENABLE
registers.description: User low threshold alarm enable. 0=Disabled, 1=Enabled

registers.name: DGT_ALARM_ARM_COUNTER
registers.description: User threshold alarm arming delay counter. The number of consecutive readings (inside window) before arming the alarm-> 0 to 63

registers.name: DGT_ALARM_TRIG_COUNTER
registers.description: User threshold alarm trigger delay counter. The number of consecutive readings outside window before triggering the alarm-> 0 to 31

registers.name: DGT_HIGH_ALARM_THRESHOLD
registers.description: User alarm high threshold value. Value depends on which item is being alarmed on(T, L, or H).

registers.name: DGT_LOW_ALARM_THRESHOLD
registers.description: User alarm low threshold value. Value depends on which item is being alarmed on(T, L, or H).

registers.name: DGT_pHIGH_THRESH_LIGHT
registers.description: High light threshold pointer(because light alarms require an array of count values)-> 0 to 255. Auto-incremented

registers.name: DGT_HIGH_THRESH_LIGHT
registers.description: High light threshold array start.

registers.name: DGT_pLOW_THRESH_LIGHT
registers.description: Low light threshold pointer(because light alarms require an array of count values)-> 0 to 255. Auto-incremented

registers.name: DGT_LOW_THRESH_LIGHT
registers.description: Low light threshold array start.

registers.name: DGT_INSTALLED_OPTIONS
registers.description: Number of things installed on the Digit 2=TL, 3=TLH

registers.name: DGT_STORED_BYTES
registers.description: Number of bytes of data stored on external flash.

registers.name: DGT_LIFETIME_READINGS
registers.description: Total number of readings saved since last cleared. Typically cleared if new battery is installed.

registers.name: DGT_BATTERY_INSTALL_DATE
registers.description: The date that the battery was installed. Timestamp format = Seconds since 1970. This parameter is used to estimate remaining battery life.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_OFFSET_FACTORY
registers.description: The factory calibration offset which can be used in the conversion of raw humidity. Write requires unlocked.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_OFFSET
registers.description: A single point offset used in the conversion of raw humidity. Units in 100s fF

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_I_SOURCE
registers.description: Read=Constant current source trim value. Write(any value)=Automatically calibrate the current source. The current source is used for humidity readings, and once calibrated, it will not need to be calibrated again.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_SLOPE_FACTORY
registers.description: The factory slope of humidity which can be used in the conversion of raw humidity. Units in %Rh per 100s fF. Write requires unlocked.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_SLOPE
registers.description: The slope of humidity used in the conversion of raw humidity. Units in %Rh per 100s fF.

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_T_SLOPE
registers.description: The temperature dependent factor used in the conversion of raw humidity. Units in 100s fF per degC

registers.name: DGT_HUMIDITY_CAL_T_SLOPE_FACTORY
registers.description: The factory temperature dependent factor used in the conversion of raw humidity. Units in 100s fF per degC

registers.name: DGT_RTCC_TIME
registers.description: The current time of the real-time-clock on the Digit. Synchronized with the computer within software. 22242 Year=0 to 99, 22243 Month=1 to 12, 22244 Day=1 to 31, 22245 Weekday=1 to 7, 22246 Hour=0 to 23, 22247 Minutes=0 to 59, 22248 Second=0 to 59

registers.name: DGT_EXTERN_FLASH_WIP
registers.description: A status flag for the external flash(data storage chip) on the Digit. 1=Write in-progress, 0=Idle

registers.name: DGT_pEXTERN_FLASH_READ
registers.description: The read pointer for external flash. Auto-incremented, simply initialize with a start address, then use 22812+

registers.name: DGT_EXTERN_FLASH_READ
registers.description: Read data from this address and subsequent addresses after pointer is initialized. Used to download data from the Digit.

registers.name: DGT_EXTERN_FLASH_bkERASE
registers.description: Erase all data on the external flash. KEY=Erase, Other=No effect, KEY=37157 Takes 5seconds to complete, so poll the WIP status flag until =0.

registers.name: DGT_pEXTERN_FLASH_WRITE
registers.description: The write pointer for external flash. Auto-incremented, simply initialize with a start address, then use 22832+

registers.name: DGT_EXTERN_FLASH_WRITE
registers.description: Write data to this address and subsequent addresses after pointer is initialized. Used primarily for firmware updates.

registers.name: DGT_SAVE_CHANGES
registers.description: 1=Save, 0=Don't save. No configuration changes become permanent until this register is used.

registers.name: DGT_RE_INITIALIZE_CONFIG
registers.description: Re-initializes the Digit to the configuration it had when connected to the computer. Clears out recent settings changes that are not yet saved.

registers.name: DGT_LENGTH_USB_SESSION
registers.description: The number of blank readings collected since connection to the computer

registers.name: DGT_FACTORY_UNLOCK
registers.description: Write a unique passkey to unlock factory settings. Only used by mfr.

registers.name: DGT_REQ_FW_UPDATE
registers.description: Request a firmware update.  Pass a value of 150 (5mS) so that the Digit has time to de-enumerate. Only used by mfr.

registers_beta.name: AIN#(0:254)_EF_INDEX
registers_beta.description: An index to specify the feature you want.

registers_beta.name: WAIT_US_BLOCKING
registers_beta.description: Delays for x microseconds. Range is 0-100000.

registers_beta.name: FIO_EIO_STATE
registers_beta.description: Read or write the state of the 16 bits of FIO-EIO in a single binary-encoded value.  Does not configure direction.  A read of an output returns the current logic level on the terminal, not necessarily the output state written.

registers_beta.name: EIO_CIO_STATE
registers_beta.description: Read or write the state of the 12 bits of EIO-CIO in a single binary-encoded value.  Does not configure direction.  A read of an output returns the current logic level on the terminal, not necessarily the output state written.

registers_beta.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:4)_TARGET
registers_beta.description: Channel that data will be written to.

registers_beta.name: STREAM_OUT#(0:4)_BUFFER_SIZE
registers_beta.description: Size of the buffer in bytes. Should be at least twice the size of updates that will be written.

registers_beta.name: STREAM_CLOCK_SOURCE
registers_beta.description: Controls advanced stream options: Immediate scan, external clock, and gated run.

registers_beta.name: STREAM_DATA_CR
registers_beta.description: Addres to read stream data from when operating in C-R mode.

errors.description: This indicates where the warning codes start is not a real warning code.
This indicates where the warning codes end is not a real warning code.
Some read/write operation(s) were not sent to the device because the Feedback command being created was too large for the device, given the current connection type.
The debug log file could not be written to. Check the LJM_DEBUG_LOG_FILE and related LJM configurations.
The device's calibration could not be read, so the nominal calibration values were used.
This indicates where the Modbus error codes start is not a real Modbus error code.
This indicates where the Modbus error codes end is not a real Modbus error code.
The device received an invalid function code.
The device received an invalid address.
The device received a value that could not be written to the specified address.
The device acknowledges the request, but will take some time to process.
The device is busy and cannot respond currently.
The device detected a memory parity error.
The requested route was not available.
The requested route was available but the device failed to respond.
This indicates where the LJM error codes start is not a real LJM error code.
This indicates where the LJM error codes end is not a real LJM error code.

comments: Use jslint.com to check validity of this JSON file after every change.
Try to go for noun_adjective_verb in register names.
2013.01.28.A:  Removed plurals on port and all digital register names.
2013.01.30.A:  Added this comments section at bottom.  Changed neg=>negative, res=>resolution, set=>settling.  Changed dio_all to just dio.
2013.02.01.A:  Added DF constants to beta section.
2013.02.07.A:  Added WiFi DHCP constants.  Added DSF read registers to beta section.
2013.02.11.A:  Changing some LJM error code names.
2013.02.15.A:  Changed readwrite values: RO => R and WO => W.  Added TDAC registers.
2013.02.18.A:  Moved TDAC registers to beta section.  Changed DAC_SCL to TDAC_SCL.
2013.02.19.A:  Added LJME_ERROR_RETRIEVAL_FAILURE.
2013.02.20.A:  Fixed tags for DSF.  Changed names for IO_CONFIG stuff.
2013.02.21.A:  Added HARDWARE_INSTALLED to beta section.
2013.02.26.A:  Added BATTERY_INSTALL_DATE to beta section.
2013.02.27.A:  Changed DSF to DF in beta section.
2013.03.20.A:  Added HUMIDITY_CAL_BAT_OFFSET to beta section.
2013.03.22.A:  Changed DF to EF in beta section.
2013.03.29.A:  Moved WIFI SSID_DEFAULT and PASS_DEFAULT to make room for 64 character passphrases. Added WIFI_UPDATE and WIFI_UPDATE_STATUS.
2013.03.30.A:  Added O-stream registers.
2013.04.02.A:  Edited O-stream register names.

2013.04.10.A:  Name changes to AIN#(0:254)_NEGATIVE, AIN#(0:254)_RESOLUTION, ETHERNET_DHCP, ETHERNET_DHCP_DEFAULT, WIFI_DHCP, WIFI_DHCP_DEFAULT, WIFI_PASS_DEFAULT, DEVICE_NAME, WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT, and WATCHDOG_STARTUP_DELAY_DEFAULT.
2013.04.11.A:  Added 42500, 7000, 7002, 7004 to the beta section (Analog EF).
2013.04.16.A:  Added WIFI_START_ADHOC.
2013.04.17.A:  Changed type of AIN_EF_RESULTS_DC_OFFSET, AIN_EF_RESULTS_P2P, and AIN_EF_RESULTS_PERIOD from FLOAT to FLOAT32.
2013.04.26.A:  Changed the spacing of EF registers.
2013.05.22.A:  Fixed WIFI_SCAN_START address.
2013.05.23.A:  Added current source cal value registers.
2013.05.26.A:  Added/Updated firmware error and status codes. 2900-2999 are status codes.
2013.05.30.A:  Changed WIFI_APPLY_SETTINGS to write-only.
2013.06.03.A:  Added registers for global AIN settings referred to as AIN_ALL_.... Moved AIN configuration registers to make room for changing settling to a float32.
2013.06.04.A:  Added registers for I2C.
2013.06.06.A:  Fixed typos in I2C section found by jslint.com.  Started adding displayname and description fields.
2013.06.07.A:  Synching the LJM error codes.
2013.06.12.A:  Removed port mask registers.  Changed names of some stream registers.
2013.06.12.B:  Removed the empty altnames
2013.06.13.A:  Added AF frequency and num-samples registers. Moved TDAC reads
2013.06.14.A:  Removed spaces from register names
2013.06.17.A:  Some EF register names were changed due to a document conflict. Used remote version and changed back to proper names.
2013.06.18.A:  More descriptions added.
2013.06.18.A:  Made descriptions a string rather than a list.
2013.06.21.A:  Changed some watchdog descriptions.
2013.06.24.A:  Added error 2358.  More descriptions added.
2013.06.26.A:  Changed some upgrade errorcodes to update.
2013.06.28.A:  Changed STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE_INDEX to STREAM_BUFFER_SIZE_BYTES.
2013.07.01.A:  Added max firmware version to stream_stop
2013.07.05.A:  Added AIN_ALL_EF_TYPE and CORE_TIMER. Changed AIN_ALL_SETTLING to AIN_ALL_SETTLING_US.
2013.07.09.A:  Added SYSTEM_REBOOT, LJME_INVALID_VALUE.
2013.07.09.A:  STREAM_AUTO_RECOVER_END_OVERFLOW
2013.07.22.A:  LJME_SYNCHRONIZATION_TIMEOUT
2013.07.23.A:  Changed STREAM_START to STREAM_ENABLE and removed STREAM_STOP.
2013.07.24.A:  LJME_OLD_FIRMWARE.
2013.07.31.A:  LJME_USING_DEFAULT_CALIBRATION.
2013.08.02.A:  Added clock count registers.
2013.08.20.A:  Changed type of I2C_WRITE and I2C_READ to BYTE.
2013.08.21.A:  Changes to I2C, SHT, and TDAC registers ... still in beta section.
2013.08.24.A:  Updated I2C to use the GO register
2013.08.30.A:  Added LJME_CONFIG_FILE_NOT_FOUND
2013.09.05.A:  Moved some entries from registers_beta to registers:  WIFI_RSSI, WIFI_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_STATUS, AIN#(0:254)_SETTLING_US
2013.09.10.A:  Added comments to the I2C registers.
2013.10.15.A:  Added digital EF read with reset register.
2013.10.16.A:  Various descriptions added.
2013.10.23.A:  Changed SPI registers. Moved HARDWARE_INSTALLED to release.
2013.10.24.A:  Moved DIO_EF to release.
2013.10.25.A:  Moved various to release.
2013.11.08.A:  SPI description edits.
2013.11.12.A:  Added FIO-EIO and EIO-CIO registers to beta section.
2013.11.18.A:  Added External flash registers.
2013.11.19.A:  Description edits.
2013.11.29.A:  Changed SPI DATA types to BYTE.
2013.12.06.A:  Changes to watchdog registers.
2013.12.09.A:  Description edits.  New internal temp sensor registers in beta section.
2013.12.10.A:  Changed SPI_SPEED to SPI_SPEED_THROTTLE.  Moved SPI to release.
2013.12.12.A:  Added Lua Regs.
2013.12.14.A:  Split the stream out buffer write register into 3 data type specific registers. Added error codes.
2013.12.19.A:  Version number at top was behind numbers in these comments.
2013.12.27.A:  Fix to the AIN_BIN register array.
2013.12.31.A:  Added WAIT and AEF registers. AIN_ALL description edits. Changed AIN#(0:254)_BIN to AIN#(0:254)_BINARY.
2014.01.01.A:  Changed data type of AIN_EF mode and CONFIG_A to uint 32.
2014.01.02.A:  Adding register-constants to DIO_INHIBIT, STREAM_ENABLE, WIFI_STATUS, and WIFI_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_STATUS.
2014.01.03.A:  Changed DIO#(0:22)_EF_VALUE_# to DIO#(0:22)_EF_CONFIG_#, removed constants from DIO_INHIBIT and STREAM_ENABLE.
2014.01.09.A:  Updated AIN EF registers.
2014.01.20.A:  Changed TEMPERATURE_AMBIENT_K to TEMPERATURE_APPROXIMATE_AMBIENT_K, updated description, updated T7 datasheet AIN 14 desc.
2014.01.23.A:  Changed TEMPERATURE_APPROXIMATE_AMBIENT_K to TEMPERATURE_AIR_K.
2014.01.27.A:  Added SBUS_ALL_POWER_DIONUM, changed SBUS data & clock defaults, and updated SBUS descriptions.
2014.01.28.A:  Updated TEST registers descriptions and default values.
2014.01.29.A:  Added error codes.
2014.01.30.A:  Added CORE tag to some often used registers.
2014.02.02.A:  Added 1-wire registers.
2014.02.10.A:  Changed AIN#(0:254)_EF_TYPE to AIN#(0:254)_EF_INDEX in beta section.  Changed DIO#(0:22)_EF_TYPE to DIO#(0:22)_EF_INDEX, but put TYPE in altnames.
2014.02.10.B:  Added Lua register for startup config and script saving.
2014.02.11.A:  Edits to watchdog and sbus descriptions.
2014.02.12.A:  SPI description edits.
2014.02.14.A:  Added file IO registers.
2014.02.19.A:  Edit to SPI mode description.
End Of Comments
